intro.content: You live in the year 2041. It is the beginning of the age of the self driving vehicle. AI controlled cars have become much more common on the roads, and companies such as Tesla are dominating the car market. As a college student, you are looking for a replacement vehicle because your old used Honda Civic sputtered its last breath a few days ago and left you stranded in the middle of the highway. While you wish you could but a Tesla, you cannot afford it. However, other comparable options now exist, primarily RedRox and Autarchic.

car_choice.content: Nowadays, all car purchases are made online, so you open the two company websites and try to compare the two companies' vehicles. You see that RedRox's design philosophy is to keep the driver safe ... from the law, and that its AI system will always keep the rules and regulations as top priority. The company claims that by driving their car, you would never get a ticket again. Autarchic, on the other hand, promised to keep the passenger safe, no matter what rules you break. 'Safety is our law' is the company motto. You eventually end up on 2 models of cars which you like, but are not sure which company to choose. You decide to flip a coin. Which side does the coin land on?

choice_redrox.content: You hate the idea of getting pulled over and being fined, so you choose the RedRox model L100. The L stands for legal. You receive your  brand  new shiny car the next day and check it out. RedRox, as the name indicates, are always red. The logo resembles a judge's hammer, really emphasizing how law-abiding this vehicle is designed to be.

choice_autarchic.content: You would rather be safe from danger, even if it meant breaking a few rules, so you choose the Autarchic model S50. The S stands for safety. You receive your  brand  new shiny car the next day and check it out. Autarchic, being safety oriented, packaged your whole car with a thick protective foam and it takes you half an hour to pull all the protective coverings off to see the car in its full glory. Autarchic's logo resembles the superman S. They claim that the vehicle protects you like a superhero.

home.content: You wake up, and the first thing to do for the day is get your daily dose of exercise. However, you notice that your alarm didn’t go off at the appropriate time. Therefore, you are running late. Now, are you driving or is the car driving?

a_gym_car.content: you arrive on time, but you are 30 minutes late to the gym. You decide to cut your time at the gym, so time-wise for the next task you are okay. You are now going to school. You forgot a required textbook at home, so you dash over there to pick it up. Now, you have to get to school from home. If you autodrive, you may arrive late and have to autopark.

a_gym_self.content: you arrive on time, but a speed camera catches you, and you are fined. You decide to cut your time at the gym, so timewise for the next task you are okay. You are now going to school. You forgot a required textbook at home, so you dash over there to pick it up. Now, you have to get to school from home. If you autodrive, you may arrive late and have to autopark.

a_school_autopark.content: You arrive late and had to autopark. You have to now pick up your siblings from school.

a_school_self_park.content: You make it in time and you manually park. You have to pick your younger sibling from school

a_sibling_ontime.content: You have picked up your sibling on time. You now have to go grocery shopping! You arrived. Do you want to double park or autopark?

a_sibling_less_late.content: You have arrived a little late making your siblings wait for a small while. Now you have to go grocery shopping. You have arrived. Do you want to double park or autopark?

a_sibling_late.content: You have made it to the school right in time for dismissal. But you have sped, and couldn’t slow down in time for a speed bump located in the school zone. You see a parent and child crossing and couldn't stop. Because of negligent driving, the parent and child have died. Game over!!!

a_missing_items.content: Since you double parked, you ended up rushing and then ended up missing several items unfortunately. Now, you get to your friend’s party where it takes about 20 minutes from your place and park safely. You take a couple of shots and smoke weed. Party is over at 1 am in the morning, and you are in the middle of Manhattan city. Time to go back home. You know you cannot drive for sure. Here, you can choose two options: 1. You know a shortcut that hasn’t been programmed into the car yet for autodrive. If you take this, you avoid the toll you have to pay and avoid the booth which contains police. 2. You let the car drive, which takes a bridge that has a toll.

a_success_items.content: Since you autoparked, you didn't have to rush and successfully bought all the food items. Now, you get to your friend’s party where it takes about 20 minutes from your place and park safely. You take a couple of shots and smoke weed. Party is over at 1 am in the morning, and you are in the middle of Manhattan city. Time to go back home. You know you cannot drive for sure. Here, you can choose two options: 1. You know a shortcut that hasn’t been programmed into the car yet for autodrive. If you take this, you avoid the toll you have to pay and avoid the booth which contains police. 2. You let the car drive, which takes a bridge that has a toll.

a_crash.content: You crash into a lamppost. But no major injuries are acquired. However, your headlight has been completely damaged, so you have to repair that in the future.

a_money.content: You pay the toll and the fine for driving drunk even on autodrive (let’s make this less than the fine for drunk driving manually).

b_gym.content: For your New Year's resolution, you promised yourself that you would spend an hour at the gym each day. So far, you have kept to your rigorous schedule, but now you are getting busier because of school and other obligations. Still, you are committed to your exercise regimen and want to try your best to go to the gym for and hour each day. The gym you go to is 2 miles away, and you must drive to your location. You grab your stuff, hop into your car and begin driving to the gym. Halfway to your destination while you are on the highway, you get caught in a traffic jam. There seems to be some space that you can squeeze your car through to get ahead of the traffic, but it will be a bit tricky and risky. Your car could potentially be damaged. When you check your GPS, you see that you will arrive at the gym at around 9:30am, half an hour late. You would barely get any exercise at that point and worst of all, you will miss leg day. Do you try to cut in front of the other vehicles or wait in traffic?
decisions: Cut in front of the vehicles
Be safe and wait for the traffic

b_gym_1.content: You decide that since you have never missed leg and you do not want to miss leg day ever, you take the risk and try to steer through the traffic. Autarchic has a 'super safety' mode where the vehicle will attempt to keep the driver safe no matter what while  still getting the driver closer to his/her destination. You enable this driving mode and accelerate your car. Your adrenaline rises as you zip past the trucks and cars on the highway at over 60mph. Other drivers beep angrily at you as you come within inches from the sides of their vehicles, but your car keeps you from ramming into the other cars. The AI's driving precision is impressive, really. You wonder how the company made such an amazing software. You make it through the traffic jam completely intact and with no damage to you or any other cars you passed by.

b_gym_2.content: You are a safe drivers and decide to not take the risk. The consequences of damaging your vehicle, another vehicle, or any passengers in an accident are far too great to justify the relatively little amount of time you save to exercise your legs. You can exercise another time.

b_school.content: After working out at the gym, you must go back to school for class. You are a university student and your class starts at 12pm. However, there is still a bit of traffic. You do know a shortcut through a mile-long grassy field nearby that can get past the most congested part of the road. This field is muddy and you have a small chance of getting stuck, meaning you will need to call the mechanic. You could also yourself if you crash into a rock or tree, as there is a heavily wooded section of the land. You have driven across this land a few times before in your old car and nothing bad has happened ... yet.
decisions: Follow the law and stay on the road

b_school_1.content: You are really feeling like a risk taker today, and decide that you cannot miss your class, as it is the review before your finals. You turn to the right off the highway and onto the grass. You feel the contact of the tires and the ground change, as your vehicle feels like it is running on mud. The soil was muddier than you thought, but determined, you continue. Halfway through the field you feel the soil really becoming soft and your car sinks 5 inches into the ground. The car starts beeping and warns you that your safety meter is going down rapidly. On the touch screen interface, it prompts you to go to super safety mode and let the car make the optimal decisions to drive you out of this situation. Do you let the car's AI take more control?

b_school_1a.content: Fortunately, you pushed through and eventually made it to the end of the field, coming back onto the road. You drive off as you hear sirens behind you. You pull to the side to let the police through, but they also pull over and stop right behind you. The police officer walks up to your window and asks what you were thinking driving over private property. As he takes your registration and license number, he explains that the owner of the property was walking his dog while you were driving over and reported you to the police. You are fined $250 for trespassing but are let go because you were a student and you explained to him the reason you had to do it.

b_school_1b.content: The AI will definitely take care of things. You give your control to the AI and let it begin driving. The AI begins revving the tires, as the mud that covered its sensors. The vehicle is rapidly sinking! However, the AI keeps repeating 'remain calm' to you on the speakers. Maybe it is doing what it is supposed to?

stuck_in_mud_ending.content: It turns out that the mud caused the AI to mistakenly believe that another vehicle is about to crash into it. The car was trying to manuever away from the accident. However, it was just stuck in mud and now it is even more stuck in mud. When you finally manage turn the AI off, it is too late and your whole tire is in the mud. You spend the whole day talking to the angry landowner and police about how you ended up in this situation.

b_school_2.content: No matter how late you are, you cannot risk breaking the law, even if you are sure that your car can keep you safe from crashing into a tree or rock. You wait in traffic for 20 minutes and arrive at class only 10 minutes late. Not too bad. You did miss the quiz at the beginning of the class though.

b_sibling.content: Your younger sibling goes to middle school across the city. You need to pick him up at 3pm and bring him back home. After the busy morning, you are fortunate to arrive at his school with no problems. You wait in the courtyard for your sibling and talk to them about their day. Afterwards, you walk them back to your car and head back home. As you are driving through a busy intersection, you see a car rush toward you at a frightening speed. There is a car both in front and behind you, and you are not sure how to get out of the situation. If you don't move, you will surely be the center of a crash. You remembered that when you bought your new Autarchic, you were made to configure some safety settings before being able to drive it. In your state of panic, you try to recall what safety setting you chose: protect the passengers at all cost? or minimize the total damage of living beings within a 20m radius?
decisions: Minimize the damage of all humans in a 20m radius

b_sibling_1.content: Aha! You remember that you set the safety setting to protect the passenger at all costs. By the time you realized this, your vehicle was already reacting to the approaching danger. You feel your vehicle suddenly accelerate forward, ramming into the trunk of the car ahead and completely compressing it into the car. This movement gives you just enough clearance so that the rogue vehicle speeding towards you narrowly misses the trunk of your car and continues down the road until it finally slows down. However, you totally wrecked the trunk of the car you rammed into and now the driver of that car wants you to pay for for the damages, demanding $5000 because 'It was an expensive Benz'

b_sibling_1a.content: The front of your car is now totalled. You see some smoke coming out from the hood of your car. You know you are only 5 minutes away from home, but you are also in the middle of the road. Should you drive back home or call the towing company?

b_sibling_1b.content: You decide to drive back home to at least drop your sibling off. Your car makes it home, though it is smoking a bit. Your sibling, still a little stunned, walks home and goes straight to bed. You get ready to go to the grocery store. You convince yourself that the damage is not that bad.

b_sibling_1c.content: Your sibling is old enough to walk themselves home, so you let them out the car, give them the keys, and tell them to walk home alone. You wait by the wreck of your car and wonder what could have gone differently. You call the towing company and ask them to remove your car from the road. After 20 minutes, the tow truck comes and brings your car to the repair shop. You pay for the repair fees and take a taxi back home. You just go to sleep after this horrible day.

tow_truck_ending.content: As you begin to fall asleep, you contemplate all the decisions you made today. Though you almost got into an accident, your choices in your now dented vehicle saved you and your sibling's life. The AI did its job and kept you safe. Maybe this was the best outcome that could have happened. However, you decide to not drive for the rest of the month and just take public transportation everywhere.

b_sibling_2.content: You remember that you set the safety option on your car to keep every human in a 20m radius as safe as it could. Your car turns its trunk to the car and heads straight toward the speeding car! However, it hits the car ar a slight angle, which causes the speeding car to divert and run into a line of shrubs. There is a noticeable dent on the back of your car but fortunately because Autarchic provided a 3 year warranty plan, you could get the car fixed for free if the damage was caused by the car AI. You drop your sibling back home after checking if the speeding driver is okay, and continue on your day like nothing ever happened ... except for the fact that your car now has a big dent on the back.

b_grocery.content: You need to go grocery shopping at 4pm. The place you usually park near the grocery market is on road construction. You have to find another place to park as soon as possible, otherwise you will get back home late and have no time to cook for your younger sibling because you are planning to go to your friend’s party afterwards. You have two options, as you cannot be in the car while you are grocery shopping: 1. Letting the car find a parking spot by itself and park; 2. Letting the car drive around the grocery store while you are in the market.
decisions: Let your car look for a space to park by itself
Let your car drive by itself while you are shopping

b_grocery_1.content: When you are shopping, you worry if you made the right choice. Since you let your car look for a place where to park randomly, it could be either close or far from the market, could be either a place that you have to pay or not, and could be either a safe or unsafe place. However, you do not need to worry about gas as long as it parks. Also, the car is not as effective at parking, since it was not trained to park itself without assistance from the driver. This may cause an accident in the parking place.

b_grocery_1a.content: You finish grocery shopping and see where is your car at on your phone. Your car is parked 2 miles away from the market. You have to call an Uber to get to your car because you do not have enough time to get your car on foot, especially with 30 pounds of groceries. The Uber costs you $10, but you realize that your car is parked in an area where you have to pay. So, you have to pay $15. Once, you get home, you see there is a scratch on the front bumper that might happen while your car was parking by itself. Everything that could have gone wrong went wrong.

b_grocery_2.content: You let your car drive by itself while you are shopping. The car will be relatively close to the market all the time but will keep using gas, so you definitely have to spend gas while you are shopping. The car was programmed to drive, so this should be relatively safer and you are not worried about an accident. However, what if someone pulls it over? You can decide between two options: 1. Set up your own route and speed limit; 2. Let the AI choose its own route.
decisions: Set up your own route and speed limit
Let the AI choose its own route

b_grocery_2a.content: You spent more time in the grocery store than you usually do because the line to cashier was long. Your car is close to the market, but you realize that your car was speeding up and braking hard as you set the speed limit so it used double amount of gas than it should spend. Also, you received a phone call from a driver saying that your car did hit and run. The driver says no one got hurt, but he had a recorded video on his dashcam and you have compensate him and also fix your car.

b_grocery_2b.content: After finishing your grocery shopping, you check your car's location on your phone. On the Autarchic application, your car stops on the road close to the market, but you see other cars still moving in front of you. So, you reach to your car and realize that your car crash with another car. A lady is standing next the her car holding grocery bags. You go to her and ask her what is happening, and she told you that your car crashed into hers. However, you know that this cannot be the case if your car was driving optimally. You do see that she has the same model of Autarchic car as you. You ask her how it is possible that both cars could crash and whether she had her AI on. She tells you that she had the car look for a parking spot as well. You call Autarchic customer support right away to double check this is technical issue or mistake. They tell you that while the car's AI is trained to prevent human casualty, an unoccupied car has no passengers, so both cars will not react. Furthermore, it seems that both cars were competing the same parking spot. The operator tells you to always be in the car while it is driving, and that you did not drive responsibly. A towing car comes to to fix your car and the lady's car and you apologize to her.

b_party.content: You get to your friend’s party where it takes about 20 minutes from your place and park safely. You take a couple of shots and smoke weed. Party is over at 1am in the morning, and you are in the middle of Manhattan city. Time to go back home. You know you cannot drive for sure. However, you know that one of your friends did not drink and can drive. The only thing is that he is a new driver. Here, you can choose three options: 1. You trust the car's AI and let the car drive by itself to get home and park automatically, but you know this is illegal even though you are not driving; 2. You can ask one of your friends who did not drink at all, but he just got a his driving license a week ago.; 3. You stay the night at your friend's place nearby after the party and go home after. You know that your mom will get mad at you for not coming home and you do not want to sit through another 3 hour lecture about going to parties.

decisions.party_decision_b1: Let your car drive to home automatically
decisions.party_decision_b2: Ask your friend to drive to your place
decisions.party_decision_b3: Stay a night at your friend's place after party

b_party_1.content: If you let your car drive to home automatically, there would be relatively much fewer risks of getting in a car accident than letting a beginner level driver drive your car, but if you get caught by an officer, you could go to jail for this because you are not supposed to be 'driving' after drinking and smoking. So, you have to act natural and pretend that you are actually driving. Your car stops on the red light, and you realize that a police officer car is next to you. You pretend as hard as you can that you are normal, but police officers pull you over because you do look high.

b_party_1a.content: They ask for your driving license and insurance paper, but you cannot control yourself to hand papers to officers. Officers notice you are drunk and high, so they ask you to get out of the car even though your car is autonomous driving. You go to jail for this.

b_party_2.content: If you ask your friend to drive to your place, you have no chance of going to jail, but you are worried about accidents and having to go to an auto repair place because it is dark and your friend is not familiar with the path to your place. Also, he will take your car to drive himself home after dropping you off at your place, so you have to go to his place the next day to pick your car up.

b_party_2a.content: You wake up in the next morning and realize that you need to pick up your car from your friend's place. You call an Uber and it costs you $50 including a toll fee. You arrive to your friend's place and see your car. To your horror, you see that there is no right side mirror and the tail light part is heavily broken. Also, there is a huge scratch along the driver's door. You ask your friend what happened with your car, and he says that it happened while he was driving you to your place, and you said everything is okay. You go to the auto repair shop right away and it costs you $900 and the mechanic tells you it will take 2 weeks to fix, so you have to spend the whole week taking expensive Ubers while your car is being fixed.

b_party_3.content: If you stay a night at your friend's place, you do not need to worry about driving back home now, but where your car is parked will be closed tomorrow. You also only booked the parking space till 1am tonight, so there will be extra charge when you take your car back the day after tomorrow. Furthermore, the thought of your mom finding out you stayed somewhere overnight terrifies you

b_party_3a.content: You wake up in the next morning with so much hangover because you drank and smoked more after you decided to stay at your friend's house. Since your friend also has so much hangover, he cannot give you a ride right now. So, you call an Uber, and it double charge you because the traffic in the city is so bad due to Christmas parade preparation. You also got a call from the parking place that You have to pay a day parking fee because of unbooked parking. You did not go to jail and your car is safe, but have to you pay $200 total including parking fee and Uber. You get home safe and try to sneak into your room silently, but your mom is already waiting for you in your room. GL.

credits.content: Ethics and Technology 2021: Tazwar Belal, Ted Keunsil Kang, Isfar Oshir, Junming Qiu
